text: The agonizing SCREAMS continue as we MOVE rapidly through labyrinth of winding underground tunnels.  Glowing torche the way.  Blurry, indistinct silhouettes of grim FIGURES black-cowled robes flash along the dank, craggy walls. As we BLAST around dark corners, we realize we are lookin the P.O.V. of a SCREAMING young woman being pushed forwar gurney.  Plunging deeper into this hellish maze. A door is SLAMMED.  Wooden.  Heavy.  Muffling the SCREAMS Spurs CLANK on a pair of silver-tipped cowboy boots as a  MYSTERIOUS STRANGER steps into VIEW.  Long black duster. Widebrimmed fedora.  Lit cigarette dangling between glove fingers.
A rat scampers from a hole, foraging in the muck of a rot rack.  A white sheet, saturated with blood, covers the pa of JAMIE LLOYD, now 16, cheeks flushed with perspiration.
Oh, God, it's coming!  It's coming! MARY, a young midwife, rushes in with a bowl of hot water lurches, knocking the bowl out of the girl's hands; it SH the floor.
(continuing) Mary, mother of God, please make it stop! Mary's face is frozen in horror.  Jamie's SCREAMS build t unnerving crescendo.  The paiin too much for her to bear.
Lurid SHOCK CUTS from the previous "Halloween" entries -- surrealistic blend of IMAGES and VOICES -- as Jamie reliv terrifying childhood ordeal:
... Ten years ago he tried to kill Laurie  Strode ... A)   LAURIE STRODE (Jamie Lee Curtis) twists and squirms strangled mercilessly in the hands of the murderous SHAPE
... Now he wants her daughter. B)   Trapped in her bedroom, 10-YEAR-OLD JAMIE (Danielle struggles to open the door.  She flings it open.  The Sha standing there, knife poised to kill!

Michael Myers is here to kill that little girl  and anyone else who gets in his way! C)   RACHEL (Ellie Cornell) dies in anguish as the Shape pair of scissors through her chest.  TINA (Wendy Kaplan) right into the path of the Shape's knife.  "Jamie, run!!! D)   Jamie sinks to her knees behind the fallen Shape, ta hand in her own.  CLOSE ON the Shape's hand.  Fingers fle life.  A grotesque BRAND on its wrist -- an inverted isoc triangle that will come to be known as the mark of THORN. E)   BLINDING EXPLOSION rips through cinderblock.  A jail to oblivion.  FIRESTORM rages.  The MYSTERIOUS STRANGER a opening fire with a SEMI-AUTOMATIC RIFLE. Pitiful wails of death.  OFFICERS writhing in pools of bl the aftermath of this carnage stands YOUNG JAMIE.
Jamie struggles against her bonds.  Pushing.  SCREAMING. in and out of consciousness during the excruciating pangs labor.  Haunted by low, moaning VOICES.  CHANTING.

RESUME Jamie, filled with repidation as she staggers thro smoke-filled cell into a darkened, drizzly alleyway. JAMIE'S P.O.V. Beyond the clearing wisps of smoke, THREE FIGURES wearing ski masks usher THE SHAPE -- arms and legs shackled in he chains -- into the back of a white van.

Mutely terrified, Jamie backs away -- into the arms of an figure, obscured by smokescreen:  the Mysterious Stranger Jamie's scream is cut off as the Stranger descends upon h the Angel of Death. A cigarette arcs throug the darkness like a tiny flare. under the boot of the Stranger. A moment later, Jamie is shoved into the front seat of th Doors SLAM.  Tires SCREECH over wet pavement.

head_text.subj: THE ENTIRE PRECINCT EXPLODES IN A HUGE CONFLAGRATION

text: A SLAP and the first cry of the newborn BABY.  Jamie sobs uncontrollably, the straps preventing her from reaching h

Please ... give him to me ... The infant is wrapped in black swaddling.  The wooden doo open.  Jamie's eyes fill with horror as the shadow of the fills the room.  Standing at the threshold.  Waiting to r the child.
(continuing) No, please ... my baby! The dark sentinels march out in somber procession, ignori desperate pleas.  Torches lighting the way.
(continuing) Damn you!!  Damn you all to hell!!! Jamie's heartrending SHRIEKS are cut off by the cold soun SLAMMING DOOR.
A diaphanous column rises, a ghostly, slow-motion cylinde flame that BURNS through the SCREEN to form the MAIN TITL

The OPENING CREDITS are BRANDED against the BLACK SCREEN invisible, kenetic force, interspersed with a SERIES OF C Jamie's baby is lain upon a primitive altar.  Ringed by e stones engraved with cryptic markings. Hooded, faceless figures.  Torches held aloft.  Disembodi VOICES.  Whispering.  Invoking a dark spell. MARY, the young midwife, peers around a corner.  Eyes gla horror.  Watching.  Spying. The newborn SCREAMS.  The flattened blade of a dagger sme triangular symbol in blood over the baby's torso. We MOVE IN on this symbol, capturing it in FREEZE FRAME. off into fiery cinders, disintegrating into DARKNESS. Silence.  Then a startling CLAP OF THUNDER as we

standing askew in a matted patch of lawn.  WIND and RAIN. FLASH of LIGHTNING illuminates: "For Sale By Strode Realty - SOLD" EXT/INT. MYERS HOUSE - SUBJECTIVE P.O.V. MOVE along a trail of drowning toys -- baseball, Power Ra deck of Pogs -- TOWARD a weather-beaten porch.  Leftover of Sears Best.  Brushes soaking in turpentine.  A dozen o 2s l;ined up to replace a row of broken railing slats. P.O.V. LOOKS UP to the tall, brooding edifice.  Address r Lampkin Lane.  Fresh coat of white paint over old clapboa shutters on the narrow windows.  A jack-o'-lantern grins filmy curtains.  The Myers house. Despite its recent face-lift, it looks just as foreboding did in "Halloween I." P.O.V. stalks down the side of the house, around to the b door.  Opens it and quietly MOVES inside. P.O.V. MOVES across the darkened kitchen.  A drawer is op LIGHTNING reveals a large butcher knife being withdrawn. P.O.V. glides past the living room -- a few boxes, furnit arranged -- and MOVES swiftly UP a long flight of stairs. Down the long, dark hallway ... through a door.  A bedroo P.O.V. FINDS 6-year-old DANNY STRODE ... tossing and turn the throes of a nightmare. An ear-splitting THUNDER CRASH causes the boy to bolt upr bed, looking right into the P.O.V.  Sweating.  Shaking.   Petrified. DANNY'S P.O.V. The THUNDER seems to ROAR from the ferocious jaws of T-RE 24" scale model posing on a shelf among an army of Jurass monsters.  Seemingly brought to life by the ELECTRICAL ST
as he leaps out of bed and pads across polished wooden fl the hallway.  LIGHTNING FLASHES.  With the next THUNDER C comes a startling, barely intelligible VOICE.
Danny ... Danny freezes.  Slowly turns.
An ominous shadow at the end of the hall, illuminated by  LIGHTNING.  Long duster and brimmed hat.  The Stranger! outstretched hand, the gleaming butcher knife!
Kill for him!
Danny screams!  THUNDER CRASHES HELLISHLY.  Lights flash Doors fly open.  Suddenly Danny is swept up in the protec of his mother, KARA, 22.
Danny! The little boy holds onto her for dear life.  Crying  hysterically.  Eyes clenched tightly.
(continuing) Shh.  Mommy's here.  What is it?
The voice man!  He's here! Kara looks in the direction he's pointing.  In the light just an antique coat rack -- "dressed" in a hat, rain jac old silver-tipped umbrella.

Danny, no one's there. Danny dares to look -- but now only cries harder. Kara carries Danny back to his room, averting the steely- of her father, JOHN STRODE, staunch, late 40s, wearing bo shorts and a well-worn undershirt.
Some of us have to get some sleep around  here.  What's with that kid? Kara ignores him as her mother, DEBRA, careworn face with compassionate eyes, tries to lend a hand.
Let me take him for you, Kara.
It's all right, Mom.  Go back to bed. Debra sighs resignedly.  TIM, 18, stocky and streetwise, torn red sweat pants and "Ice-T" t-shirt, casually replac Walkman headphones and returns to his room.
Kara opens the closet and switches on the light.  Satisfy that it's empty, she breaks into her perfunctory routine.
Stay away monters, stay away ghouls. Stay away  from Danny.  You jerks know the rules.  (crossing to Danny's bed) Better? Danny giggles as his pretty young mother tucks him in.
Mommy, when can we go home? Kara sighs.  They've been through this one before.
Home is here in Grandma and Grandpa's new  house.  At least while I'm in college.   Remember our deal.
The kids at school said this is a haunted  house -- that a bad man used to live here.
They did, did they?  Since when did we start  listening to the kids at school?
But I've seen him!
You've been watching too much TV.
He says things.  Bad things.
Like what? Danny is afraid to tell her.

(continuing) If you mean the things Grandpa says sometimes,  ignore him.  Once he gets to know you he'll  come around ... Let the bad things you hear  slide right off your back. Kara tousles his blond hair and kisses his forehead.  The goes to the closet, just about to turn out the light --
(sitting up; panicked) No, Mom -- keep it on!
Okay ... But just for tonight. Kara adjusts the closet door, causing one of Danny's scho drawings to fly off the wall.  She picks it up on her way
(continuing) Good-night, Danny. Kara softly closes the door.  Danny lies awake, blankets to his chin, eyes wide.  Still very much afraid.

Kara yawns, removes her glasses and rubs her eyes, settin drawing on a pile of open books.  Cliffs Notes and Diet C cans.  Telltale signs of a late-night cram session. Adjusting the dial on her FM/alarm clock, Kara begins to about the little room, slipping out of her clothes as the subtly-seductive voice of a WOMAN comes over the radio:

I know this sounds crazy, Harry, but I love  him.  I write to him every week. I think I  even want to have his child -- The woman is cut off by the nasally, steel-trap voice of SIMMS, talk radio's most popular man of controversy:

Let me get this straight, Debi.  Now you're  saying that not only does this guy get you  sexually aroused, but now you want to bear his  offspring?! Wearing only her bra and panties, Kara moves to a full-le mirror and lets down her long, flaxen hair.  Beneath her exterior, she is quite attractive:  delicate features wit enviable, naturally-toned figure.
Deep down, he's just like you and me. He just  needs someone to understand him.  Someone to  love him.

You're talking about one of this nation's most  notorious serial killers like he belongs in  some kind of Est seminar!  What planet have  you been on, lady?  Michael Myers has been  dead for six years! A CLICK as the woman is abruptly DISCONNECTED. Kara suddenly whirls around, startled by a FLASH of somet face -- in the mirror! Drawn to the window behind her, she rubs off rainy mist a outside. KARA'S P.O.V. of the large Victorian frame house directly across the st Another FLASH OF LIGHTNING reveals the shadow of a man st the uppermost window -- looking right at her!
Frightened, her eyes lock on Danny's drawing.  A child's  scribbling in red Crayon:  The triangular symbol of Thorn

Kara draws the priscilla curtains over the window as we P through the pouring RAIN ... toward the house across the An ornate sign on the front door reads: "Blankenship House - Rooms Available" CRANE UP toward the window where the shadowy figure stand insidious CRASH OF THUNDER as we PUSH through the window.
A macabre display of old newspaper headlines, arranged  helterskelter on a wall:  "HALLOWEEN KILLS ESCAPES FROM A

head_text.subj: OF TERROR ENDS AS MYERS PERISHES IN VIGILANTE EXPLOSION."

text: Harry Simms BOOMS over a state-of-the-art HiFi system.  A tape RECORDS the continuing broadcast.

Now we've got someone who claims he's actually  seen Michael Myers.  Does this whacko caller  have a name? Staring out the window at the Myers house, TOMMY DOYLE, a strapping 25-year-old with reddish brown hair and intense cradles a cordless phone.

My name's Tommy.  I was only eight- years-old  when I saw him.  But I was lucky.  I survived. Tommy paces nervously around his sparsely-furnished attic apartment.  Classic horror movie one-sheets and mint firs comic books share wall space with a chilling array of gun knives, and survivalist weapons.
Sounds like you're a candidate for  electroshock therapy, Tommy.  Don't tell me  after all this time you still believe Myers is  alive?! Tommy pauses, mesmerized by one of the newspaper clipping

Michael's work isn't finished in Haddonfield.   Now it's just a matter of time before he comes  home to kill again.  But this time I'll be  ready. MOVE IN TIGHT on the headline, frail and yellowed by age: "November 1, 1978.  TOMMY DOYLE SURVIVES BABYSITTER BLOOD Directly beneath this:  "November 3, 1989.  JAMIE LLOYD F
CLOSE ON a photograph of young Jamie and
Jamie remains strapped to the table, wrapped in bloody sh Eyes closed.  Deathly still.  Suddenly an urgent, WHISPER pierces the darkness:
Jamie?  Jamie?! Jamie startles awake to see the midwife frantically relea straps.

Come with me if you want to save your baby. Jamie can't believe her eyes.  Mary opens a threadbare kn revealing the baby inside! A soul-shuddering RUMBLE echoes throughout the cavern.  J leaps up, eyes wide with fear, sensing the evil presence.
Oh, God ... He's coming!
We've got to move.  Now! Pulsing with adrenaline, Jamie harnesses the knapsack ove shoulders and follows Mary out into the tunnels.
Chains GRIND over rusted pulleys.  A massive iron gate ri revealing a pair of filthy work boots.  Legs planted in b stance as a tall, ominous shape begins to emerge.
The terrified midwife leads Jamie with her baby on a brea flight through the winding network of tunnels.  Haunted b ECHOING SOUNDS of the rising gate.
Gliding forward into the hollow catacombs.  Slow by deter Sensing the way.
Reaching a corner, Mary stops and sends Jamie off in the direction.
There!  It's that way!
No --
Save your baby -- go now! Jamie runs, disappearing down the dark tunnel.  Mary quic removes her shoes and tears off, now SILENT. STALKING P.O.V. surges around a corner.  FINDS Mary.  MOVES IN on her.

Mary turns in small circles.  Fear mounting as she falter darkness.  Heavy, labored BREATHING fills the tunnel. A mask -- the pale, neutral features of a man weirdly dis the rubber -- materialized out of the void right behind h

Mary turns, about to scream when the Shape lunges out, li up by the nape of the neck and SLAMS her forehead into a metal SPIKE jutting out from the cavern wall! Leaving her impaled like a fish on a hook, the Shape resu relentless pursuit.  Eerie under the lighted torches.

Jamie runs frantically.  Methodical, heavy FOOTSTEPS behi She chances a look behind.  The Shape is coming! Jamie vaults up a dark stairwell.  A trap door above.  It budge.  Jamie frantically POUNDS against the hatch. The Shape mounts the stairs! Strength fueled by sheer desperation, Jamie forces the do Tumbles onto muddy ground.

Jamie drags herself out of the hole and half-runs, half-s with her baby through an ugly, charred forest.  Sharp bra whip at her face.  RAIN falls.  LIGHTNING streaks across As if hell-spawned, the Shape emerges from the undergroun and trudges forward, bold and unstoppable. Jamie tumbles into a gully, nearly dropping the knapsack. picks herself up, hands groping at rain-sopped earth.  Th is right behind her!
A slap-happy, overweight MOTORIST sips coffee from a 7-11 straining to see the road through falling rain and fogged glasses.  Harry Simms keeps him mindlessly occupied.
Next up is Dwayne.  What's on your feeble  excuse for a mind, "Dwayne?" The Motorisft lets out a hardy GUFFAW, spilling his coffe
Shit! Fingers burning, he searches the glove compartment for a
I'd just like to say that I listen to your  show every night, Harry.  I think you're the  best.  I can't tell you how excited we are  that you'll be paying a visit to our little  town tomorrow night.
Do you have a point to make here, Dwayne, or  should I just keep practicing my wrist  exercises?

(chortles) Harry, you're too much.  I'd just like to say  that I understand how things have changed in  the 90's.  Gays in the military, cut off your  husband's do- jigger, become a national hero.   But I just can't see any sense in bringing  Halloween back to Haddonfield. The Motorist looks up.  Eyes go wide with panic.  Startle
Jamie stands in the middle of the road, SCREAMING bloody-
Tires SCREECH.  The pickup stops on a dime.  The Motorist sits there, mouth agape as the shrieking girl throws open and clambers into the passenger seat.
Drive!  Goddamnit, drive! Through his side-view mirror, the unsuspecting Motorist s outline of a quickly-approaching man.  Unrolling his wind rubbernecks a look outside.

Hey, what do you think you're -- CRUNCHING BONE and TEARING FLESH as the Shape's hands sho through the window, twisting the man's head off his shoul Jamie SCREAMS!  Lunges for the steering wheel.  Slams her down hard on the gas.
The pickup bullets forward, fishtailing up the road, neve down as the driver's door flies open, dumping the motoris headless bulk into a muddy ditch.
Jamie drives.  Checks to see that her baby is safe.  Then a PRIMAL SCREAM.  A hysterical release of fear and rage, out by the squabble of VOICES over the radio:

You're coming here for this Halloween fair --  it's all just a game -- a publicity stunt for  you, isn't it Harry?  These kids -- they're  not old enough to remember what Myers did  here. They look up to you.  Now you're just  asking for trouble.
You people really get me.  What are they  putting in the water in that town?

LIGHTNING FLASHES and RAIN pelts the windows of a bucolic This is a man's retreat and has been for years.  Dark woo leather, a few tastefully-chosen antiques.  Floor-to-floo shelves containing a myriad of books and an impressive di awards and degrees, all bearing the name:  SAMUEL J. LOOM After a STATION IDENTIFICATION, "The Harry Simms Show" re tinny-voiced CALLERS blaring over a handsomely-restored 1 Bremer-Tully.
All these fanatics aside, Harry, I'd  personally like to thank whoever did the  masked one in.  Saved us tax-payers a lot of  money in the long run.

Yeah, that sucker's been dead for six years.   It's about time they had a Halloween revival  in this town.  Now my kids can stop driving me  crazy! MOVE IN behind a bald, sharp-featured man, hunched over a he reminisces over a collection of framed photographs -- of his wife and children.

What happened to that psychiatrist of his?   Loomis, I think was his name.  I heard the old  quack was dead. Turning at the mention of his name is DR. LOOMIS himself, spectacles, a comfortable sweater and his trademark goate the first time ever, we actually see him smile.  The burn his face have all but faded away.  Last traces of the hor

Not dead.  Just very much retired. Loomis hobbles to the desk and finishes cutting out a new article.  As he arranges the strips of paper in a leather scrapbook, a sudden KNOCK at the door gives him a startle

An ominous FIGURE, clad in hat and trench coat, stands be glowing porch light, silhouetted in the pouring RAIN. Loomis opens the door, eyes straining in the semi-darknes to identify his unexpected visitor.
(sudden recognition) What the devil?!  Come in -- come in!
Shuffling inside, dripping with rain, DR. TERENCE WYNN, a well-dressed gentleman in his 50s, removes his hat and co quickly making himself at home by the crackling fire.
Christ, what a night!  Not even so much as a  sign for five miles on that road!
That's the whole idea of living in the  country.  I thrive on the seclusion. Wynn heads for the kitchen, rummaging through cabinets an as Loomis dutifully wipes up his muddy trail.

Don't tell me that the reviled Rasputin of  Smith's Grove has grown complacent in his  golden years.  I don't buy it for a single  second, Dr. Loomis. Loomis immediately senses that Wynn has an angle.

And in all these years, I've never known you  to make house calls, Dr. Wynn.  Especially at  this hour ... Wynn returns with a bottle of Irish whiskey and two shot Thrusts one in Loomis's hand and begins to pour.

Unlike you, Sam, I learned many years ago not  to second-guess the motives of my fellow man.   Remember what Freud said:  'Sometimes a cigar  is just a cigar.'  Or, in this case, a drink  is just a drink.
I hope you didn't come all the way out here in  this storm just to quote Freud.

As always, your keen powers of perception  astound me.  And you're right.  I've come to  celebrate.  (raising his glass) After thirty-two years as Psychiatric  Administrator, guess who has been named  Smith's Groves new Chief of Staff.
But surely Rogers isn't --
Retiring. Loomis is abruptly stunned and delighted by the news.
Why -- congratulations!  I can think of no one  better suited for the position. The two old sparring partners drink to the occasion.  But angle soon comes to the helm.
Of course, I need a new Administrator. Someone  who can bring new life -- and some old blood,  if you'll pardon the expression -- back to our  program ... Loomis prepares himself for the bomb.
(continuing) We need you, Dr. Loomis.
You should know that it's not wise to play  Halloween pranks on me.

You're the only man for the job, Sam. Things  haven't been the same since you left.  I'm  recruiting the best psychiatric team in the  country.  Old colleagues.  This is your change  to finally make a difference. Loomis scratches his head and settles down into his comfo easy chair, amused at the irony of Wynn's speech.

Even after my stroke six years ago they  practically had to hold a gun to my head to  get me to retire.  Now things have changed.   I've changed.  The ghosts have been buried.   Why on earth would I want to dig them up  again? Loomis finally looks over at Wynn, surprised to find him at the desk, looking through his scrap book.
Seems to me there's at least one ghost that's  still lurking in your closet. We follow Wynn's gaze down toward the open page.  A blazi tabloid headline:  "MICHAEL MYERS - DEAD OR ALIVE?"
Jamie's getaway truck ROARS around a bend, tearing up a d stretch of highway.  The STORM rages.
Jamie strains to see as she drives through sheets of RAIN weary, fighting panic, holding one hand steady against th the other on the CRYING infant.
God ... Help us, please ... Something up ahead.  Jamie's face fills with expectancy.
A lighted sign appears out of the darkness.  Glowing salv Familiar red-white-and-blue logo.  "GREYHOUND."
The pickup drives into the glow of orange vapor lights. a stop in a deserted parking lot.  Jamie staggers out, cr the knapsack as she runs toward the old depot.

Jamie blasts through double glass doors.  But the bus sta devoid of life.  Empty benches.  Blank ARRIVAL/DEPARTURE  signboard.  The low hum of vending machines. Jamie moves toward the ticket counter.  A handwritten sig the attendant:  "BACK IN 20." Shivering, holding her baby, Jamie enters an old-fashione booth.  Picks up the receiver and immediately dials 911.

You have reached Haddonfield Emergency  Services.  Due to severe weather conditions,  all circuits are momentarily busy.  If this is  not an emergency, please dial directly ... Jamie slams the phone down in terrified frustration.  Sud becomes aware of the radio program.  Piped in over ancien loudspeakers:

For anyone who gives a flying circus, this is  Harry Simms -- the light in your night, the  love of your loins -- and I want to hear from  more of you bogeyman believers out there.  So  give me your best shot at 1-800-878-7274.  That's 1-800-URTRASH! The STATION IDENTIFICATION cuts in.  Jamie picks up the r frantically dials the number.
Wynn doesn't give up the sales pitch even as Loomis leads door.  The radio program still squawking in the b.g.
But with Rogers and his house of hacks gone,  you'd make the rules.  Just think it over.
Please try to understand, Terence. I've already  made up my mind. As Wynn continues to talk, his voice trailing off into no Loomis's attention is diverted to the VOICES on the radio
So they're trying to kill you and your baby.   Don't tell me.  Your name also happens to be  Rosemary.
(intense whisper) No -- please listen!  They're coming ... coming  for me and my baby. Loomis's eyes widen; a man possessed.
Come on, sweetheart -- what is this? Who's  coming?
It's ... Michael ...  (releasing) ... Michael Myers! Loomis staggers.  A lifetime of nightmares coming back to all at once.
PRESS IN TIGHT ON TOMMY in bed.  Listening through headph Sitting upright.  Thunderstruck.
Somebody help me!  Dr. Loomis, are you out  there?  Can you hear me?
Wynn watches with rapt attention as Loomis unlocks his sa withdraws a metal case.  He pops it open, revealing his t Magnum and a box of cartridges.

A bus has arrived.  The ATTENDANT returns to his post.  J up the phone, filled with trepidation as PASSENGERS file strung-out ROCKER.  A pair of stern-faced NUNS.  A PRETTY greeted in the loving arms of her BOYFRIEND. Just as she is about to step out of the phone booth, a TA back turned, wearing a hat and black trench coat, moves t outside the booth!  Jamie freezes. Securing her baby in the knapsack, Jamie throws open the Suddenly the Tall Man steps in her path!
Are you all right, young lady? Shaking uncontrollably, Jamie shrinks away.  Backing down hall through the door marked "LADIES ROOM."

Water runs into a grimy basin.  Unable to contain her tea washes the newborn.  Takes a roll of paper towels and tri the triangular blood mark off his chest. Suddenly the lights go out.  Jamie gasps.  Clutching her turns off the faucet and melts into the darkness. The door CREAKS open.  FOOTSTEPS echo inside.

has locked herself inside one of the stalls.  Heart pound FOOTSTEPS grow louder.  Jamie's eyes dart frantically. STALKING P.O.V. MOVING methodically past the row of stalls, pushing open revealing that they are all empty.  A CRASH from the last P.O.V. moves toward it.  RUSTLING and MOVEMENT inside. A HAND pushes on the door.  An open window above the toil is gone!

Jamie trembles off a stack of crates piled beneath the wi dashes around the side of the depot. Suddenly the bus ROARS by, sending up a muddy wave as it disappearing down the highway. Jamie moves swiftly across the parking lot, clutching the She throws open the door of the pickup and jumps into the seat.

Slapping down the locks, Jamie thrusts the key into the i The engine REVS to life.  She guns it, peeling out of the lot.  Back toward the highway. She drives on, suppressing her tears, stealing glances at knapsack bunched up on the passenger's seat.  Then she tu looks forward with concentrated attention. JAMIE'S P.O.V. A sign looms ahead:  "Haddonfield Memorial Hospital - 10
Jamie sighs with relief, steadying the wheel just as -- HIGHBEAMS flash on right behind her, a juggernaut roaring blackness!  Jamie's eyes flood with terror.
The grill of a familiar white van shoots forward, SLAMMIN against the pickup's rear bumper.
is jolted forward in her seat.  Holding on the wheel with white-knuckle grip as she's repeatedly hit from behind.

The unseen madman noses forward, veering sharply over the yellow line, scraping sides with the truck. Headlights sear a path through the night, locked in neck- profile.  SPARKS flashing at 70-miles-per-hour. The van forces Jamie onto the shoulder.  It leaves the ro branches from trees.  Jamie SCREAMING.

A quick-cut MONTAGE, events ticking out in fractions of a like a nightmare: The pickup springboards over a gulch and slams down hard, spinning in waves of mud, careening through a vast field. pumpking patch. The van reappears in a glare of headlights.  Its engine s with fire-breathing rage. The pickup puts on a furious burst of speed.  Eating up p spinning out chunks of splattering seeds and pulp. The van bears down hard, slingshotting across the field, past the pickup, cutting right in front of it.

Something heavy is thrown from the back of the van right windshield! Glass EXPLODES!  Jamie SCREAMS, hands going up instinctiv protect her face.  Swerving wildly out of control. She looks to see a sprawling, mutilated corpse on top of cold, lifeless eyes -- Mary!
No!!!
The pickup rockets at breakneck speed toward the edge of Suddenly -- JAMIE'S P.O.V. The Shape stands in the field, tall and unmoving, white m hideously in the rush of oncoming headlights.

The truck plows into the Shape, dragging it under, SLAMMI into the trunk of a huge oak tree. Everything is abruptly and shockingly silent.  Like a pha night, the van is gone.  The Shape nowhere to be seen. Steam billows from the pickup, engine TICKING, a heap of glass and mangled steel.  Pinned against the base of the shape in human form -- a scarecrow! MOVE IN on Jamie, face-down against the steering wheel. the noxious fumes, she stirs back to life.  Slowly, painf shoulders the door.  Falls onto the ground. A SPARK ignites.  BLINDING FLASH as the gas tank EXPLODES the truck ablaze.  Jamie turns, her face a frozen rictus Debris rains down on her. Suddenly a grim shadow rises from the field.  The Shape - an enormous butcher knife! Jamie rolls onto her back, SCREAMING.

Tommy's my new friend.  We've been playing 'til  you got home.  He knows all about dinosaurs. One look at Danny's black eye and Kara goes ballistic.

Hellllo, Haddonfield!!! The crowd turns in a mass of confusion.  Standing above t from a microphone, is HARRY.  Dark sunglasses.  Gaunt, gl features and an outrageous mane of black hair. Making his way through the teeming crowd.  Walkie-talkie The helicopter zooms overhead.  Wynn's voice squawks over RADIO CHATTER.  Conducting a surveillance by air.

Him. Tommy flashes a newspaper article in front of her.  One w eariler:  "MICHAEL MYERS - DEAD OF ALIVE?" The baby's SCREAMS are verging on overload.  Tommy dashes recessed kitchen area and heats up another bottle. As Kara reads, Danny tugs at his mother's blouse.

Shhh.  It's okay, Kyle.  Just give me one  more --  (the microwave BEEPS) -- second.  There you go, big guy. Kara looks on as Tommy attempts to feed the baby.  Despit clumsiness, she's undeniably moved. Behind them, Danny's imagination kicks into high gear as Power Ranger over an invisible race track.  On the floor. the windowsill.  Glancing across the street.

Here.  Let me try. Tommy gingerly hands the baby over to her.  Instantaneous CRIES subside.

Kyle's mother might be dead for all I know.   Now I'm afraid he could be next.

Not just Kyle.  All of you.  His entire family.  (reaching toward Kyle) Here.  Look at this. Tommy opens the baby's quilt, revealing the blood mark sm his torso.  Kara's face registers terrified recognition.

CLOSE ON a chapter heading.  "Thorn - The Devil's Rune." it, a bold depiction of the familiar Thorn triangle. PULL BACK to REVEAL Tommy poring over the old library boo paces, rocking the baby, feeding him with the bottle.

Runes were a kind of early alphabet that  originated in Northern Europe thousands of  years ago.  They were symbols -- carved out of  stone or pieces of wood.  Of all the runes,  Thorn had the most negative influence. Cults  used them in blood rituals to portend future  events and invoke magic.

Black magic ...  (reads) 'In ancient times, Thorn was believed to cause  sickness, famine and death. Translated  literally, it was the name of a demon spirit  that delivered human sacrifices ... on the  Celtic celebration of Samhain.'
Halloween.

'When applied directly to another person, Thorn  could be used to call upon them confusion and  destruction -- to literally visit them with the  Devil.' Tommy jumps up, frantically moving around the apartment, his jacket, his keys -- a gun.
(terrified) Where are you going?

To find the rest of your family before Michael  Myers does -- or whoever's been controlling  him. An ominous CLICK as Tommy loads a cartridge into his gun. toward the door.  Finds it standing wide open.  Kara free noticing for the first time that Danny is missing.
Oh, God -- Where's Danny? Kara flies down the  hall, the baby in her arms.  Tommy moves out  right behind her.
Kara and Tommy barrel downstairs, searching frantically.
Danny?!  Danny!
Mrs. Blankenship, have you seen the little boy  who came in with me and -- They find Mrs. Blankenship and Danny sitting side by side the Horrorthon.  A bowl of popcorn between them.
(grabs him) Danny, don't ever walk off without telling me  where you're going! Danny looks at her.  A blank, hollow stare.  The old woma glitter madly.
The voice.  He hears the voice.  Just like the  other little boy who used to live in that  house. Tommy throws on his jacket and opens the front door.

Take the kids upstairs, lock the door and wait  for me.  (beat) And Kara, whatever you do -- don't go back to  your house. Kara watches fearfully as Tommy heads out the door.  Leav alone with the children.

Taillights disappearing. A moment later, another car rambles up the street, swervi erratically into the driveway of the Myers house. The Shape watches.

The car parks.  Sits in silence.  Suddenly the driver's s opens, emblazoned with the "Strode Realty" emblem. John spills out, collar unbuttoned, tie dangling.  Pickin up, he staggers out of the garage.  Laughing.  Singing.
... Pretty woman, walking down the street ...  Pretty woman, the kind I'd like to meet.
FOLLOW John's circuitous route across the front lawn, stu one of Danny's toys on his way up the porch steps.
Damn kid ... this is my house ... John fumbles wth his key, estimates the location of the l turns the knob -- but the door's jammed.  Chain-locked.

Two and a half ... John slams his weight against the door.  It doesn't budge Grumbling, John totters off the porch, trying to hold him steady.  Skirting along the side of the house.
John sways in through the back door and flicks on a light for lucidity.  No one in the kitchen.
Debra -- I'm home! No answer.  John shrugs and moves to the stove.  Opens th pasta cooker.  Nothing inside.

(continuing; mutters) Work all day and not even any supper ... Frustrated, John opens the freezer and removes a frozen d Tears open the box and pops it in the microwave.  Then he down the dark alley, knocking picture frames awry.
Darkness, save for a glowing jack-o'-lantern.  John stand listing.  Bewildered. Then he switches on a lamp, kicks off his shoes and crash lumpy old recliner.
All right ... You can all come out now ... Still no reply.  John sneers, flicks on the television wi remote control and settles back into his chair.
A scene from another horror movie.  A boy shreds his pump a mass of beetles and snakes pour out of his skull.
What is this shit? Disgusted, he switches channels to the local NEWS.  A shr from the kitchen startles him.  The microwave.

John waddles to a drawer and removes a set of utensils. reaches for the microwave, opens it.  But his dinner is g Spinning around, he sees the piping hot entree already si on the kitchen table.  John double-takes, mentally retrac steps.  Shrugs.
as he picks up his tray and plods back down the hall.  Su trips over something -- the suitcase Debra had packed ear sitting smack-dead in the center of the hall.
So this is the game you wanna play. Fine.  Go  ahead.  Keep it up all night ...
John settles back into his chair and begins to eat raveno SCREAMS from the television.  He reacts.

John shakes the remote.  Out of the corner of his eye, he shadowy figure darting by in the darkened foyer.
Is that you, you little brat?  Danny?! John rises, about to go for him when suddenly the power c and the entire house is plunged into blackness.
(continuing) When I get my hands on you, kid, you're gonna  wish you were never born! John pulls a rechargeable flashlight from the wall and go cellar door.  It stands open.  An invitation to enter.

John tentatively descends the stairs.  Barefoot.  The fla beam preceding his every step.  A RUMBLING below. The cellar is lit only by a shaft of moonlight cutting th single dusty window.  John probes around, shining the fla over cobwebs, boxes -- the puddle of water at his feet. flooding the entire floor. John SCREAMS as the S him by the neck, lifts him off the floor with one hand, t him across the basement and SLAMS him brutally against th box. The Shape's free hand lifts an enormous butcher knife. John's toes curl.  The skin around where the knife penetr FRIES.  The Shape steps back, head tilted, BREATHING stea curiously observing John's hanging, lifeless body.

Children carving jack-o'- Parents beaming with pride. Trendy co-eds playing games.  Ducking for apples.  Shooti pumpkin-faced balloons with water pistols.

Our  generation will not let the powers-that-be  control our minds, dictate what clothes we  wear, what music we listen to, or what holidays  we celebrate. Beth's rousing speech is met by gales of enthusiastic CHE
(off-handedly) Have you ever considered running for public  office?

He heard the voice.  Same as your boy hears.
What voice?  What are you talking about?

The voice that spoke to Michael Myers. The one  that told him to kill his family. Kara stares at her, numbed.  She gazes over at Danny, his riveted  -- not to the TV screen.  Looking past it.  Acro street at the Myers house.  The haunting VOICE whispers t

Walking, searching, hunting.  Past a large tent where chi gathering.  A sign reads:  COSTUME PAGEANT. Tommy reacts to a terrified SCREAM.  Just a couple of tee pulling an innocuously fightened GIRL onto another ride.
walks steadily past the bright lights of the Ferris wheel
pushes through a dense crowd.  Suddenly he bumps shoulder Stranger.  More people pass.  There was something very si about that man. Tommy turns to look again, eyes widening in terror.
Branded with the mark of Thorn!

removes his gun.  Flows through the crowd like a vengeful People see the gun in his hand and back away.  Tommy surg forward.  The Stranger walks faster.  Gaining ground.  To Halloween tree. WORKERS hauling wheelbarrows loaded with jack-o'-lanterns path.  Tommy stumbles, pumpkins spilling out all around h The Stranger is getting away!  Tommy picks himself up, ra gun and begins FIRING shots into the air.  People SCREAM, like insects, ducking for cover.

Stop that man!  Stop him!!! Tommy races through the horrified crowd.  The Stranger ke never once looking back. Suddenly SIRENS.  Squad cars converge.  Sheriff Holdt and OFFICERS surround Tommy.  Weapons trained.
Throw down the gun!  Now!!! Tommy drops the gun.  Puts his arms up in surrender.  The in, taking him.
Stop that man!  He's the one!
Beth and Tim exit the ride and follow the crowd toward th LIGHTS of the police cruisers.
Who's gettin' busted? Beth is stunned to see Tommy being searched spread-eagle sheriff's car.
Jesus, that's my neighbor.  Tommy.
Isn't he that psycho who's been spying on my  sister?
(worried) Kara and Danny never showed up tonight. We'd  better go home and check on them. There's  nothing else for us to do here.
But they're gonna light the tree in a few  minutes --
(suggestively) We can light our own tree at home. She brushes against Tim's crotch and saunters away.  Tim back at Tommy, then follows her like a hungry puppy.
Kara rushes Danny and the baby inside.  The old spinster her heels.  Releasing her dark secret.
I was baby-sitting for him that night. Little  Mikey Myers from across the street.  That's  when the voice told him what to do.  Same as  his great- grandfather.
His what?!

Eighteen-ninety-five.  A hundred years ago to  this night.  All Hallows Eve. Murdered his  family in that very same house.  Then the  townspeople burned him alive.  Our mother  always told us when we were children, 'Don't go  near the Myers house.'  We never did.

The Stranger glides unnoticed among a large crowd gathere lighting of the Halloween tree.  People putting up umbrel STORM fast approaching. Hundreds of anxious kids stand beneath the oak tree with and pillow cases, waiting for the candy to drop on them.
MOVING behind the tree where a long-haired figure stands darkness.  Waiting to make a presentation.
turns, sensing a presence.  A knife shoots out of the dar jabbing him right between the legs.
is shoved into the back of the squad car.  Suddenly Loomi Prevailing upon the sheriff.
Wait!  This boy is being placed in my custody. Tommy looks out, stunned.
What are you trying to pull now, Loomis?
Uncuff him!  This is a matter of life or death.
The knife is lifted straight up, splitting his torso in t bugging with shock.  He slumps to the ground in a huge po blood.
The sheriff uncuffs Tommy and shoves him out of the car.
You'd better as fuck have an explanation for  this, Doctor. Loomis begins to usher Tommy through the gaping crowd.
